intro: Sideroxylon wallichianum, commonly known as the Himalayan ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a leathery texture. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, clustered in greenish-yellow cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
